intro: Harpalium sericeum, commonly known as the silky harpalium, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a silky, hairy texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Harpalium sericeum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
